name: Functional GPU Programming:
tagline: Accelerate and Obsidian benchmarks for my undergrad project
body:
### Introduction

This project is about analysing and comparing Accelerate and Obsidian, two domain-specific languages embedded in Haskell that automatically produce CUDA code for GPUs.

In this page you will find all the information related to the project including all the code used for the benchmarks and the complete project report.



### Contact
For further information you can contact me through [email)(albertosadde@gmail.com), [Twitter](twitter.com/aesadde) or [LinkedIn](uk.linkedin.com/in/aesadde).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
